item.name: create a view or edit request

request.description: you need to send the current user id. This is the user requesting access to content they cant view or edit. You have the following options to send. Don't send more than one. "project": { "id": 3 }, "funding": { "id": 3 }, "checklist": { "id": 3 }, Then you have to tell the API what is the type of the request: "type": "edit" or "type": "view"

formdata.value:
{"subject":"Testing Subject","group":"3","body":"

Hello,

This is a test email body. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed vestibulum quam ac felis convallis, at ultrices lorem interdum. Proin eget tortor a ligula semper sagittis.

Nulla facilisi. Fusce non feugiat eros, nec laoreet mi. Sed auctor pharetra velit, id lacinia eros mollis id. Phasellus at luctus magna. Integer sodales nisi eget risus cursus sodales.

Sincerely,
John Doe

"}

formdata.description: after you create an entry you get it's id then you put it here
the field name of the images in the API [ in this case in API projects, the image field is named uploads ]
the files you want to uplaod
